intro: Unxia digyna, commonly known as the Chinese bellflower, is a flowering plant native to China. It belongs to the Campanulaceae family and is characterized by its bell-shaped blue or purple flowers. The plant typically grows in mountainous regions and has hairy stems and leaves. It is often found in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in temperate climates. Unxia digyna is valued for its ornamental beauty and is sometimes cultivated in gardens.
